bug.author: vinzeebreak
bug.summary: Dates frontend is very slow - choosing a date is very slow and unresponsive
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
Dates are very slow to manipulate inside the browser. Feels "buggy". <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Code app.py: import streamlit as st
def main(): st.date_input("date")
if __name__ == "__main__": main() Then, streamlit run app.py Finally, try to manipulate with your cursor the date object inside your browser. <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
It should be fast to choose a date. <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
Interface is very slow and therefore hard to use <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
yes <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.64.1.dev20200728 Python version: Python 3.6.8 Using virtualenvwrapper OS version: Ubuntu 18.04 Browser version: Mozilla Firefox 78.0.2

comments.comment: Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/vinzeebreak>@vinzeebreak</denchmark-link> - I can't reproduce this using Chrome or Firefox, also using Ubuntu 18.04. Any chance your system resources like RAM are at 100% usage?

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/randyzwitch>@randyzwitch</denchmark-link>
Just tried again on my personal computer. My RAM was only 1/3 full and my CPU was completely fine. OS: Ubuntu 18.04 Browsers: Mozilla Firefox 79.0 & Google Chrome 84.0.4147.89 Python 3.6.8 & 3.7.6 streamlit-nightly==0.64.1.dev20200728 <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18598248/89018923-dab40f80-d31c-11ea-93ed-93692fd32ca8.gif></denchmark-link>
Experiencing the same behavior with the following configuration: streamlit-nightly-0.64.1.dev20200728 OS: Ubuntu 19.10 Python 3.8.2 Mozilla Firefox 78.0.2 (64-bit)

I tried to find which version introduced this bug: ❎ = bug seen ✔️ = no bug pip install streamlit: 0.64.0: ❎ 0.63.2: ✔️ pip install streamlit-nightly: 0.63.2.dev20200722 : ❎ 0.63.2.dev20200721 : ✔️ I managed to find the commits between the 2 nightly versions: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/compare/0.63.2.dev20200722...0.63.2.dev20200721>0.63.2.dev20200722...0.63.2.dev20200721</denchmark-link> and I am puzzled.. The bug cannot come from this.. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/randyzwitch>@randyzwitch</denchmark-link> Are there any external files that are included inside the that could introduce the bug?

Thanks for looking into this <denchmark-link:https://github.com/vinzeebreak>@vinzeebreak</denchmark-link> ! There are no external files that are included as part of our release process. At first I was quite puzzled but I think we were just comparing the tags in reverse. Looking at this makes much more sense: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/compare/0.63.2.dev20200721...0.63.2.dev20200722>0.63.2.dev20200721...0.63.2.dev20200722</denchmark-link>
It's very probable this is a regression caused by <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/pull/1747>#1747</denchmark-link>
Just tested again today on Ubuntu 18.04 and 20.04 with streamlit==0.71.0 and it works like a charm!
Great, thanks for confirming! Closing this issue, but if you think there's more to do, happy to re-open it.
